item.title: Health Care Industry Drives Job Growth At The Expense Of Efficiency
item.description: May 19, 2017 - As the debate over health care continues in Washington, one thing not in dispute is that health care industry employment has been going up steadily over the past decade. In Ohio, health care industry jobs now outnumber those in manufacturing. The jobs are good news to state and local economies, but some analysts also say it's a reflection of the high costs and complexity of health care.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 19, 2017 - As the debate over health care continues in Washington, one thing not in dispute is that health care industry employment has been going up steadily over the past decade. In Ohio, health care industry jobs now outnumber those in manufacturing. The jobs are good news to state and local economies, but some analysts also say it's a reflection of the high costs and complexity of health care. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/19/529175744/health-care-industry-drives-job-growth-at-the-expense-of-efficiency

item.title: 50 Years Ago, A Network Of Clergy Helped Women Seeking Abortion
item.description: May 19, 2017 - Before Roe v. Wade, a network of clergy helped counsel women seeking abortions and sometimes helped them find abortion providers. Some of them are gathering in New York this weekend to mark the 50th anniversary.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 19, 2017 - Before Roe v. Wade, a network of clergy helped counsel women seeking abortions and sometimes helped them find abortion providers. Some of them are gathering in New York this weekend to mark the 50th anniversary. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/19/529175737/50-years-ago-a-network-of-clergy-helped-women-seeking-abortion

item.title: The Ripple Effect Of Cuts To U.S. Funds For Overseas Abortion Services
item.description: May 19, 2017 - Foreign aid restrictions introduced by President Ronald Reagan in 1984 have been expanded by the Trump administration. They could hinder HIV prevention and the fight against infectious disease.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 19, 2017 - Foreign aid restrictions introduced by President Ronald Reagan in 1984 have been expanded by the Trump administration. They could hinder HIV prevention and the fight against infectious disease. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/05/19/528778797/the-ripple-effect-of-cuts-to-u-s-funds-for-overseas-abortion-services

item.title: Poll: Doctors Are Still Prescribing Lots Of Opioids For Low Back Pain
item.description: May 19, 2017 - More than half of Americans suffer lower back pain each year, the latest NPR/Truven Health Analytics survey finds. And they're often not going for treatments recommended as safest and most effective.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 19, 2017 - More than half of Americans suffer lower back pain each year, the latest NPR/Truven Health Analytics survey finds. And they're often not going for treatments recommended as safest and most effective. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/19/528516985/poll-doctors-are-still-prescribing-lots-of-opioids-for-low-back-pain

item.title: The Slums Of Buenos Aires Are Too Wet And Too Dry
item.description:
May 19, 2017 - On rainy days, wastewater floods into homes. Yet on those very same days, residents often can't draw water from their taps.
- http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/05/19/527995345/the-slums-of-buenos-aires-are-too-wet-and-too-dry
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: Fact Check: 'We Don't Have Health Care In This Country,' Trump Says
item.description: May 18, 2017 - The president said on Thursday the Affordable Care Act is "dead. It's gone." The Senate is considering repeal legislation passed by the House, but Obamacare isn't faring as badly as Trump suggests.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 18, 2017 - The president said on Thursday the Affordable Care Act is "dead. It's gone." The Senate is considering repeal legislation passed by the House, but Obamacare isn't faring as badly as Trump suggests. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/18/529022011/fact-check-we-dont-have-health-care-in-this-country-trump-says

item.title: Women Opt To Skip Pelvic Exams When Told They Have Little Benefit
item.description: May 18, 2017 - OB-GYNs and primary doctors disagree on whether women need a pelvic exam every year. When women were told a medical society recommended against it, they were much less likely to have the exam.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 18, 2017 - OB-GYNs and primary doctors disagree on whether women need a pelvic exam every year. When women were told a medical society recommended against it, they were much less likely to have the exam. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/18/529005614/women-opt-to-skip-pelvic-exams-when-told-they-have-little-benefit

item.title: Is 'Internet Addiction' Real?
item.description: May 18, 2017 - What started out as web surfing by a healthy teen descended into online obsession and isolation. Was it depression, internet addiction or both? Whatever you call it, rehab is now part of the answer.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 18, 2017 - What started out as web surfing by a healthy teen descended into online obsession and isolation. Was it depression, internet addiction or both? Whatever you call it, rehab is now part of the answer. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/18/527799301/is-internet-addiction-real

item.title: Orangutan Moms Are The Primate Champs Of Breast-Feeding
item.description: May 17, 2017 - Orangutans breast-feed up to nine years, longer than any other primate. That may help offspring survive food shortages. But humans may have gained a survival advantage from weaning earlier.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 17, 2017 - Orangutans breast-feed up to nine years, longer than any other primate. That may help offspring survive food shortages. But humans may have gained a survival advantage from weaning earlier. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/17/528776636/orangutan-moms-are-the-primate-champs-of-breast-feeding

item.title: Common Lead Test Can Give False Results, FDA Warns
item.description: May 17, 2017 - Common blood tests for lead can give falsely-low results in certain cases, according to a new warning from the Food and Drug Administration.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 17, 2017 - Common blood tests for lead can give falsely-low results in certain cases, according to a new warning from the Food and Drug Administration. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/17/528793444/common-lead-test-can-give-false-results-fda-warns

item.title: Ethics Of Aid: Should Donated Health Dollars Go To 'Children First'?
item.description: May 17, 2017 - That's how health aid is now allocated in the developing world. Should more money go to old people with chronic diseases? Our audience shares their views.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 17, 2017 - That's how health aid is now allocated in the developing world. Should more money go to old people with chronic diseases? Our audience shares their views. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/05/17/528620977/ethics-of-aid-should-donated-health-dollars-go-to-children-first

item.title: A Tale Of Four Famines
item.description:
May 17, 2017 - Climate and conflict have left millions with little to no access to food in Somalia, South Sudan, Nigeria and Yemen.
- http://the1a.org/shows/2017-05-17/a-tale-of-four-famines
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 17, 2017 - Climate and conflict have left millions with little to no access to food in Somalia, South Sudan, Nigeria and Yemen. http://the1a.org/shows/2017-05-17/a-tale-of-four-famines

item.title: Secret To Maine's Touted High-Risk Pool? Enough Money
item.description: May 17, 2017 - GOP legislators say Maine's "invisible high-risk pool" was a good model for how to insure people who have pre-existing conditions. Critics say Maine's program was much better funded than the GOP plan.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 17, 2017 - GOP legislators say Maine's "invisible high-risk pool" was a good model for how to insure people who have pre-existing conditions. Critics say Maine's program was much better funded than the GOP plan. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/17/527960631/the-idea-the-gop-s-health-care-bill-borrows-from-maine

item.title: Food To Cure What Ails You: When Cookbooks Treated Meals As Medicine
item.description: May 17, 2017 - At the turn of the 20th century, when access to professional care was spotty, many cookbooks served up recipes for the sick — some (brandy) more appealing than others (toast water).
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 17, 2017 - At the turn of the 20th century, when access to professional care was spotty, many cookbooks served up recipes for the sick — some (brandy) more appealing than others (toast water). http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/05/17/528123967/food-to-cure-what-ails-you-when-cookbooks-treated-meals-as-medicine

item.title: From A Millennial To Her Peers: Want to Help The Underserved? Sign Up For Insurance
item.description: May 17, 2017 - A law student was touched when she had a seizure during a big exam and classmates dropped everything to help. But if you really want to help sick people, she says, "you'll sign up for health care."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 17, 2017 - A law student was touched when she had a seizure during a big exam and classmates dropped everything to help. But if you really want to help sick people, she says, "you'll sign up for health care." http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/17/527416507/hey-millennials-want-to-help-the-underserved-sign-up-for-insurance
